div.div:
Once you have installed the Firefox Extension, Dispute Finder will examine the pages you browse, looking for sentences that imply claims that other users have said are disputed.
If Dispute Finder finds a sentence that makes a disputed claim, it will highlight it on the page to let you know that there are other points of view that you might want to investigate.
If a sentence is highlighted, it does not mean that the claim it is making is wrong. Dispute Finder makes no attempt to determine if a claim is true, only if it is disputed. You should not interpret the number of sentences that are highlighted no a page as an indication of the accuracy of an article.
